quotes: As of 2004, Ms. Luísa Dias Diogo is the first woman ever to hold the position of Prime Minister in Mozambique.
She began working in Mozambique’s Finance Ministry as the National Budget Director in 1982,
held the office of Deputy Minister of Finance & Planning from 1994 to 2000,
Minister from 2000 to 2005.
In 1994, as Deputy Finance Minister in the FRELIMO government, she was a key player in drafting the first five-year development plan
In 1999, Ms. Diogo was promoted to Minister of Finance,
In July 2004, Ms. Diogo officially launched an AIDS Emergency Programme,
In the January 2004 issue of The Banker, she was named Finance Minister of the Year for Africa.
she was also distinguished by Times Magazine as one of the world’s 100 most influential personalities in 2004,
as one of the world’s 100 most powerful women by Forbes Magazine in 2004 and 2005.
